data.title: Untitled Document
data.text:
NPR'S JARL MOHN: Broadcast Radio Is The Cockroach Of Media. You Can't Kill It

THE MOUTH, FEBRUARY 10TH, 2015 –– NPR CEO Jarl Mohn, longtime broadcast radio's Lee Masters, must be exuding a lot of panache these days. On the heels of monster successes such as 'Serial' and the recent blockbuster 'Invisibilia,' he has a lot to be happy about. In a lengthy interview with current.org's Ben Mook, when responding to a prediction that Vivian Schiller had made when she was NPR’s CEO, Mook quoted her as saying the Internet radio would be replacing terrestrial radio within ten years. 'We’re now five years into that decade. What’s your prediction about the future of terrestrial vs. Internet radio? Mohn: Broadcast radio is the cockroach of media. You can’t kill it. You can’t make it go away, it just gets stronger and more resilient. That doesn’t mean that I see digital radio as a passing fad. It’s for real. I’m a huge Spotify user. I think it’s a great service, but I use broadcast too." With regard to commercial radio, Mohn said, "It’s suffering right now, in part because of the incredible consolidation and cost-cutting that has occurred in the business. There’s less room for creativity, innovation and local relevance. Most often, it’s not live .. Over-the-air commercial radio is not as good as it can be." Mohn added, 'We are in the golden age of the spoken word, whether it’s about news, culture or science. Some of it’s going to be on broadcast, and some will be digital. It’s not an either-or. The radio listeners and digital users aren’t making either-or choices. Mohn’s background includes managing and owning radio stations, working as a program director, managing VH1 and MTV, and holding the chief executive job at E! Entertainment. Consultant Walter Sabo, a friend of Mohn, told Jockline, “Jarl Mohn is an amazing man. He grew from progressive rock DJ and programmer at WLRS in the 1970’s to a formidable media visionary. I would pay close attention to what he says about NPR and its appeal." READ COMPLETE ARTICLE HERE

First-Ever On-Stage Focus Group Of Talk Listeners Reveals Key Insights

While there was an overall feeling that talk radio could do some things better, there was a clear love of the product

THE MOUTH, FEBRUARY 10TH, 2015 –– NuVoodoo Media Services has released the findings of a live focus group of talk radio listeners conducted on stage at the Talk Radio Boot Camp on Saturday, February 7, at the W Hotel in Buckhead/Atlanta. Carolyn Gilbert, President of NuVoodoo Media Services and Leigh Jacobs, Executive Vic e President, Research Analysis for NuVoodoo Media Services, conducted a live focus group of talk radio listeners in front of a room of talk radio managers, consultants, programmers and hosts. Panelists were men and women, aged 40-54, who were active talk radio listeners from Atlanta who were comfortable speaking in front of a room full of people. There was no mirror or video camera between respondents and viewers. Gilbert and Jacobs moderated the panel that later took live questions from the industry heavyweights in attendance. The eight panelists represented a balance of Conservatives and Liberals, but even the Liberals admitted to spending time with the more Conservative-leaning talk hosts. Conversely, the Conservatives in attendance were aware of offerings on NPR and several referenced shows they listen to regularly on the local NPR station. While those in the room reaped the full benefit of experiencing the comments and insights shared by the respondents, several themes lit up the session: Among the findings, there was dissatisfaction with the existing state of conservative-oriented talk and the feeling that if you hear any of the shows on a particular day, you have heard them all. Many complained about too much political talk and praised host such as Clark Howard for bringing up topics and information they found interesting and useful. Several others mentioned the boredom of a string of callers who do nothing more than agree with the host. While there was an overall feeling that talk radio could do some things better, there was a clear love of the product and a passion for myriad variations of the talk format. For more information about these findings, contact Carolyn Gilbert at NuVoodoo Media Services at 888.9VOODOO (888.986.6366) and at cg@nuvoodoo.com.

[WATCH] Domestic Violence Advocates Up In Arms Over Radio Host Being Served Divorce Papers On-Air

THE MOUTH, FEBRUARY 10TH, 2015 –– Domestic violence advocates are up in arms following Real Radio 104.1/Orlando's Russ Rollins being served divorce papers on-air. According to wftv.com, advocates said the host shouldn't be 'cashing in' off his divorce now that a staged video has has gone viral. WTKS-FM posted video of Russ Rollins supposedly being surprised by divorce papers that outline domestic abuse claims. “Wow, so she had me served on the air. That’s very nice,” Rollins said in the video during his "Monsters in the Morning" program. Rollins' estranged wife accuses him of beating her. She's now demanding transcripts of the radio show in her legal battle. Channel 9's Steve Barrett contacted the station to ask if it was taking domestic violence issues seriously. Carol Wick, CEO of domestic violence shelter Harbor House, said the station may need a better domestic violence policy. "I think this is the kind of thing that happens when companies don't have those kinds of policies in place." In recorded video, there's a look of shock on his face, Barrett said. Rollins' estranged wife said she, too, has received threats from those who believed the videotaped stunt. According to WFTV, Rollins has not commented on the incident other than on his radio show. He has not been charged with domestic violence.

ABC News Radio To Offer Special 2015 Tax Tips Programming

THE MOUTH, FEBRUARY 10TH, 2015 –– ABC News Radio Offers Special 2015 Tax Tips Programming Hosted by ABC News Correspondent Richard Davies & ABC News Chief Business and Economics Correspondent Rebecca Jarvis 30-Part Feature Series Available Now ABC News Radio has launched its annual Tax Tips series, tackling all the tough tax topics to provide listeners with a wide range of helpful information when filing for returns this year. ABC News Correspondent Richard Davies and Chief Business and Economics Correspondent Rebecca Jarvis anchor the 30-part series with insight from the best tax experts in the field and the IRS. From understanding new tax laws and protecting private information from hackers to cataloging and organizing all of the proper paperwork, Davies and Jarvis answer the questions most concerning during tax filing season. ABC News Radio’s “Tax Tips 2015″ is now available in :60 and :30 second versions.

EXECUTIVE ACTION: Beasley Media Tampa Names Steve Triplett DOS

THE MOUTH, FEBRUARY 10TH, 2015 –– Beasley Media Group Tampa Bay has named Steve Triplett Director of Sales for the Company’s Tampa-St. Petersburg-Clearwater cluster of six radio stations (five FMs and one AM) that includes: 92.5 MAX!MA WYUU-FM; BUBBA 98.7 WBRN-FM; Tampa Bay’s Country Station 99.5 WQYK-FM; Tampa Bay’s Hits of the 70s, 80s and more! Q105 WRBQ-FM; The Bay’s Party Station WiLD 94.1 WLLD-FM; and Money Talk 1010 WHFS-AM. Steve spent the first decade of his career in various account management roles for Jacor Communications, Clear Channel Radio and Cox Radio. Steve Triplett adds, “I’m thrilled to join the Beasley team. The company has a rich history and a stellar reputation within the broadcasting community. We are living in one of the most innovative times in the history of marketing and it’s clear to me that Beasley is committed to leading the way with engaging brands and a relentless focus on generating results for advertisers.” Steve Triplett can be congratulated at 727-579-1925 and steve.triplett@bbgi.com.

[WATCH] Gordon Ramsey 'In The Doghouse' With Wife After 'I'd Put A Hole In Her Donut' Comment About Radio Host

THE MOUTH, FEBRUARY 10TH, 2015 –– Looks like TV chef Gordon Ramsay will have to come up with more than a romantic dinner to get out of the doghouse with his wife. This came after his comment: ''I’d put a hole in her donut'' directed to syndicated Kraddick show member Kellie Rasberry. According to mirror.co.uk, Ramsay admitted he was thinking of the Dish Nation host Kellie, being his date and then admitting after the boast that he is now in the doghouse with wife Tana. While on Dish Nation, he described his ideal Valentine’s night, saying: “Do it at home. Start with oysters, take dessert to bed.” Ramsay, then admitted he was thinking of Kellie and Dish Nation host Kellie, 46, being his date. And he stunned viewers by blurting out: “I’d go out on Valentine’s Day with Kellie, definitely 'I’d like to put a hole in her donut.” The Hell’s Kitchen star then quickly said, “I’m in s*** now. I’m definitely in the doghouse. “I only came on the show because I thought Kellie was gonna be here.” WATCH HERE

MOTION: Art Laboe Searching For Next Opportunity; Rocky D Exits WQSC-AM Charleston

THE MOUTH, FEBRUARY 10TH, 2015 –– In the wake of iHeartMedia/Los Angeles flipping KHHT - Hot to Real 92.3, there are many Pros on the Loose including Art Laboe and his syndicated show… Being a part of the Hot 92.3 programming for so many years afforded The Art Laboe Connection the opportunity to work with some of the best and most talented industry professionals. We wish the best of luck to the new format and to all those that were let go to make way for Real 92.3… Art Laboe is exploring options with iHeartMedia and in talks with other stations to find a new L.A. home for his nightly show. In the meantime, the show continues in syndication. The show is available for other markets, inquire with Dale Berger at 760-699-2297. ####### Local afternoon radio personality Rocky D has left WQSC/Charleston after nearly three years at the station. Rocky, whose full name is Rocky Disabato, gave The Post and Courier the news on Monday. Operations manager Ted Byrne said the slot is being filled by Todd Schnitt.

Big 98.7 Fargo's Jesse And Amanda Finally Make It To 'The View'

THE MOUTH, FEBRUARY 10TH, 2015 –– Without a minute to spare before Rosie O'Donnell's just announced 'second' departure from the popular tv show, Fargo's Big 98.7 FM "Jesse and Amanda with Pike in the Morning" show, along with family members finally made it to the the set of "The View" on Monday morning to meet Rosie O'Donnell. This all began when Amanda Lea tweeted a plug to an upcoming segment on Rosie's well publicized gaffe calling their show 'Talk,' their top competitor. This got a response from O’Donnell herself who called into to the show for an extended interview. She then invited the hosts to fly to New York for a taping of “The View.” Although not featured during the taping, which featured Ashley Graham, actor Victor Rasuk and director Spike Lee, they were allowed to walk on stage. O’Donnell also introduced Pike to co-host Whoopi Goldberg whom he admitted to have a crush on. Of course, the mood may have been tempered a bit by the announcement of Rosie's departure from the show just days before their arrival. Eerily, not a word was mentioned on the show and Lea said It was kind of awkward for everybody.” Aside from the show's trip to the show, this was an extras special occasion for Lea who was able to bring along her Mother who’s been diagnosed with terminal ovarian cancer and got to visit New York City for the first time PHOTOS/Courtesy of Jesse James - From left to right. .. Stephanie, Jesse 's wife, Jesse James, Rosie O'Donnell, Amanda, Amanda's mom, Amanda's boyfriend Steve, Pike and Pikes girlfriend Lauryn.

Judge Rules Jean Kasem Responsible For Legal Costs In Husband's Estate

THE MOUTH, FEBRUARY 9TH, 2015 –– A judge said on Friday that Casey Kasem‘s widow, Jean Kasem, has no legal right to object to payment of attorney’s fees and costs related to the establishment of a conservatorship over her late husband, thus, clearing the way for money to be obtained from the Casey's estate or the family trust. According to mynewsla.com, LA Superior Court Judge Lesley Green will make the final determination of how much to award, but the petitioners collectively are asking for about $350,000. Attorneys will also seek additional fees to compensate them for having to oppose Jean Kasem’s objections to the fees requests. The attorneys involved in the filing the petition said they also will seek additional fees to compensate them for having to oppose Jean Kasem’s objections to the fees requests. Jean Kasem’s attorney, Frank Busch, argued that his client is the only one who has been looking out for her late husband’s interests from the start, but Green said that did not give her the right to object to the fees. “Your client had the opportunity to establish standing and hasn’t done that,” Green told Jean Kasem’s attorneys. The petitioners, who include the lawyers for Kasem’s daughter, Kerri Kasem, said the primary evidence offered by Jean Kasem’s attorneys amounted to two declarations from Kjetil Johansen. He is a lawyer in Norway, where Casey Kasem is buried. Kasem's estate and trust' worth are estimated at $80 million including Kasem's home in Holmby Hills valued at about $40 million. Kerri Kasem is asking to be reimbursed for travel expenses to the state of Washington, where Kasem died after his wife moved him from a Santa Monica care facility.

MOTION: iHeart Fresno Taps Steve Weed Operations Mgr.; Teefa To Host Hip Hop Show On Soul 106.3 Chicago

THE MOUTH, FEBRUARY 9TH, 2015 –– iHeartMedia Fresno announced today that Steve Weed has been named Operations Manager, effective immediately. As Operations Manager, Weed will oversee all aspects of iHeartMedia Fresno's eight stations' operations. He previously served as Operations Manager for the Fresno cluster in 2010 and in 2011 became Operations Manager for iHeartMedia Sacramento. Weed's experience includes past roles as a media brand manager and broadcast programmer in key major markets such as Detroit, Seattle and St. Louis for Entercom, Bonneville Broadcasting and EZ Communications. He also worked as an on-air personality in New York City and Los Angeles. ####### Soul 106.3 recently announced plans to debut a new feature show entitled, “The Basement” hosted by Chicago rap artist and former Power 92 on-air personality Teefa, reports rollingout.com. Calling it a show designed for the 'mature' hip-hop lover, listeners tuning into “The Basement” can expect to hear tracks frm Notorious B.I.G. to Master P. Teefa said not only is the music a natural fit for her, but it’s something the market needs as well. “I was raised in hip-hop culture. It literally shaped me to be the woman I am today,” Teefa said. “Throwback hip-hop has been homeless in terms of mainstream radio in Chicago for a long time now. I’m honored to be on 106.3 with my family and playing music I am passionate about. I am truly blessed. I can’t even call it work because I’m having too much fun.” “The Basement” is set to premiere on Soul 106.3 (WSRB-FM) on Monday, Feb. 9 and will air each weekday from 10 p.m. to 12 a.m.

KIPPER MCGEE: Will Broadcasting Exist in 2525?

THE MOUTH, FEBRUARY 9TH, 2015 –– At this past weekend's Talk Show Boot Camp in Atlanta, veteran radio manager, program director and consultant Kipper McGee announced publication of his new book ‘Brandwidth: How Big Broadcasting Missed the Mediamorphosis’, which offers 7 ways YOUR brand(s) can avoid their mistakes. The book is being published by Eckhartz Press in Chicago. “We live in a time when broadcasters are being attacked in ways not even dreamed about a decade ago”, said McGee. Noting the need for broadcasters to reboot their brand portfolios, he added “many operators insist on acting penny wise and PPM foolish”. The writing has been on the web for decades. Now Kipper reveals common traits of the biggest winners and losers and offers powerful takeaways for ANY brand planning to thrive in the ever-changing digital world order. Helping drive home key points is noted illustrator Jessica Hagy. “I’ve been a fan of Jessica’s brilliance since her first book, “Indexed” was released and follow her blog (www.thisisindexed.com) every day. “I’m thrilled to have her join me on this exploration of our changing mediascape.” The book is expected to drop in spring. Pre-publication orders are being taken at HERE

TSBC6 ATLANTA: Packed With Plenty Of 'Wow' Moments

THE MOUTH, FEBRUARY 9TH, 2015 –– As a rule, the producers of Talk Show Boot Camp usually let its attendees and others recap highlights. Making one exception, TSBC founder and co-presenter, Don Anthony, expressed special pride with this year's event saying 'This one had an uncanny number 'wow' moments.' With a lineup that boast numerous top executives, programmers and talk personalities, attendees were also treated to a 'Live' focus group presented by NuVoodoo Research's Carolyn Gilbert. Anthony added, 'Ours goal has always been to inspire as much as inform. Judging by an inbox full of enthusiastic comments, it appears we hit our mark." Among many comments: "The marquee names that gathered at Talk Show Boot Camp speaks to the importance our industry places on spoken word radio, and to the willingness to keep learning how we can keep our shows in the hearts and the hands of the fans," Lori Lewis/Jacobs Media. "#1 takeaway is we need to stop talking like radio people and communicate like normal human beings," Cumulus Media's Bruce Gilbert. "This was my 5th TSCB. Each year, you are able to identify the needs of the industry and gather together the most respected minds to contribute their honest and humble opinions as to what we ALL can do to make great radio and ensure our industry evolves with the times. This year was no exception,"- Victor Lisle ReelWorld. "Truly a great event! It's more important than ever for the industry to meet and tackle the tough questions in a rapidly changing content environment, and (TSBC) provides the platform for that valuable discussion," - Dom Theodore The Blaze. "Last year was great. I thought this year's content surpassed it," Bryan Crabtree. "Congrats on TSBC6! As always, this event tackled the most important issues and opportunities facing our industry like no other. Herman Cain was just ONE of the "wow" points in an outstanding lineup," Kipper McGee. Look for more details and info on NuVoodoo's focus group in an upcoming edition.

77 WABC Celebrates Valentine's Day With Live "What Women Want" Series

THE MOUTH, FEBRUARY 9TH, 2015 –– 77 WABC New York celebrates Valentine’s Day every day this week with the “What Women Want” live webcast series on wabcradio.com. Hosted by 77 WABC’s Cooper Lawrence, “What Women Want” reveals the secrets women hold dear on keeping relationships strong and fulfilling. Each day this week, leading up to Valentine’s Day, Cooper interprets the rules of the romance game... From what women want in a man, to real advice on keeping relationships exciting. Check it out this week-- and thanks for spreading the news! The “What Women Want” webcast series airs live today thru Friday, February 13, at 12 Noon ET, exclusively on wabcradio.com.

Westwood One Hangs With The Stars Backstage At the 52nd Annual GRAMMY Awards

THE MOUTH, FEBRUARY 9TH, 2015 –– The Hollywood Hills were alive with more than just recording artists this past weekend for the 52nd, Annual Grammy Awards. There were radio peeps roaming the halls, too, there for Westwood One’s “Countdown to the GRAMMYS." Backstage for Red Carpet Radio Row, some of entertainment's top stars such as Jack Antonoff took time to visit Ty Bentli, co-host of Westwood One’s “Countdown to the GRAMMYS” and NASH/America’s Morning Show’s Erika Grace Powell. Jack’s other indie-pop band Bleachers’ debut album, Strange Desire, was one of USA TODAY’S top five albums of 2014. Also stopping by was country star Miranda Lambert, who was nominated in four categories—“Best Country Album,” “Best Country Solo Performance,” “Best Country Duo/Group Performance,” and “Best Country Song”—is interviewed backstage at Westwood One’s GRAMMYS Red Carpet Radio Row. Last month, Miranda launched her Certified Platinum Tour, and will be playing nearly 30 cities with special guest Justin Moore and featuring some of Country’s hottest up-and-coming female artists.
